addJersey.q: How do I add a jersey to my collection?
addJersey.a: Browse our catalog of thousands of jerseys, click on a jersey then on 'Add to my collection'. You can enter size, condition, purchase price and much more.

customPhotos.q: Can I add my own photos?
customPhotos.a: Yes! In addition to official photos, you can upload your own photos for each jersey in your collection.

privacy.a: Yes, by default your collection is private. You can choose to share it with your friends or remain anonymous in rankings.

pricing.a: Yes, Le Vestiaire is 100% free to manage your collection, wishlist and enjoy all features.

lucas.quote: I shared my wishlist at Christmas and my family loved it! No more duplicates and I got exactly the jerseys I wanted.

sarah.name: Sarah D.

tom.name: Tom R.
tom.quote: My friends gave me exactly the jerseys from my wishlist for my birthday. It's great to be able to share your passions easily!

ctaSection.title: Ready to create your wishlist?
ctaSection.subtitle: List your wishes and share them in a few clicks with your loved ones

howToCreate.question: How do I create my wishlist?
howToCreate.answer: It's simple! Browse our catalog, click the heart to add a jersey to your wishlist. Then click 'Share' to generate your personalized link.

multipleWishlists.question: Can I create multiple wishlists?
multipleWishlists.answer: For now, you have a single wishlist that you can modify at any time. You can choose which jerseys to share each time.

howToView.question: How do my loved ones see my wishlist?
howToView.answer: You generate a unique link that you share by message, email or social media. They can view your list on mobile or PC, without creating an account.

pricing.question: Is the wishlist free?
pricing.answer: Yes! Creating, managing and sharing your wishlist is 100% free, with no limits.

received.question: What happens when I receive a jersey?
received.answer: Once you add the jersey to your collection, it automatically disappears from your wishlist. No more duplicates!

customize.question: Can I customize my wishlist?
customize.answer: Yes! You can choose a theme (Christmas, Birthday...), add a title and a personal message for your loved ones.

hero.title: Welcome to
hero.subtitle: Manage your football jersey collection, create your wishlist and join a community of passionate fans.

userStats.title: Your Collection

userStats.startCollection: Start your collection to see your stats!

features.title: Why choose The Locker Room?
features.subtitle: The free app designed by collectors, for collectors

catalogCollection.title: Catalog your collection
catalogCollection.description: Record all your jerseys with their details: size, condition, purchase price, customization. Track the value of your collection.

shareableWishlist.title: Shareable wishlist
shareableWishlist.description: Create your wishlist and easily share it with your loved ones for Christmas, birthdays or any special occasion.

authentication.title: Jersey authentication
authentication.description: Learn to recognize authentic jerseys from counterfeits with our detailed guides for each brand (Nike, Adidas, Puma...).

community.title: Community of enthusiasts
community.description: Connect with other collectors, share your finds and discover your friends' collections.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about The Locker Room

addToCollection.question: How do I add a jersey to my collection?
addToCollection.answer: It's very simple! Search for the jersey you own in our database, then click 'Add to my collection'. You can then fill in all the details: size, condition, purchase price, etc.

shareWishlist.question: Can I share my wishlist for Christmas or my birthday?
shareWishlist.answer: Absolutely! Create your wishlist, customize it with a message, and generate a unique link to share with your loved ones. They'll be able to see your wishes without needing to create an account.

authenticateJersey.question: How can I spot a fake jersey?
authenticateJersey.answer: Check out our 'Authentication' section where you'll find detailed guides for each brand. We explain how to verify labels, stitching, logos and other details that distinguish an authentic jersey from a counterfeit.

availableClubs.question: What clubs and leagues are available?
availableClubs.answer: Our database includes jerseys from all major European leagues (Ligue 1, Premier League, La Liga, Serie A, Bundesliga) as well as many international clubs and minor leagues. We regularly add new jerseys!

dataSecurity.question: Is my data secure?
dataSecurity.answer: Yes, we take security very seriously. Your data is hosted in Europe (France) and protected according to GDPR standards. You remain the owner of your collection and can export it at any time.

Authentication.title: Jersey Authentication
Authentication.subtitle: Learn to identify authentic football jerseys from counterfeits

protectInvestment.title: Protect your investment
protectInvestment.description: The football jersey market is unfortunately flooded with counterfeits. Our guides help you identify authentic jerseys and avoid scams.

whyImportant.title: Why is authentication important?
whyImportant.reason1: Counterfeits represent up to 30% of the online jersey market
whyImportant.reason2: A fake jersey deteriorates quickly and has no resale value
whyImportant.reason3: Buying a counterfeit finances smuggling networks
whyImportant.reason4: Authentic jerseys guarantee quality, comfort and durability

adidas.description: Complete guide to authenticate an Adidas jersey. Verify product code, swing tag, barcode and spot counterfeit signs. Detailed method with visual examples.

nike.description: Learn to recognize an authentic Nike jersey: product code, production code, swing tag, and security tag. Complete anti-counterfeit guide with comparative photos.
nike.ogDescription: Learn to recognize an authentic Nike jersey from a counterfeit

puma.description: Puma jersey authentication: product code, production date, QR code, security tag. Recognize the 'Fat Cat' and other fake Puma jersey signs.

adidas.title: Adidas Authentication Guide
adidas.description: Complete method to verify the authenticity of an Adidas jersey using product codes and labels

step1.title: Step 1: Locate the label with the product code
step1.description: The label is usually found in the collar on the right, or sometimes at the bottom of the jersey with washing instructions

points.point1: Look for the label sewn in the collar (right side)
points.point2: If not in the collar, check at the bottom of the jersey near washing instructions
points.point3: This label contains 3 essential codes: size, product code (middle), and manufacturing code
points.point4: If the label has been cut off by the seller, it's impossible to verify authenticity

step2.title: Step 2: The product code (MOST IMPORTANT CODE)
step2.description: The middle product code is the key to verifying authenticity. Example: IB0907

points.point1: Identify the code in the MIDDLE of the label (e.g., IB0907, HS5184, P95985)
points.point2: This code is unique per jersey model (home, away, third)
points.point3: Type this code in Google Images: results must match your jersey EXACTLY
points.point4: Example: 'IB0907' = Lyon Away Jersey 2023/2024 only
points.point5: If the code matches another club/season = IT'S A FAKE
points.point6: Exception: Some small clubs share the same code (common templates), but it's rare

step3.title: Step 3: The swing tag (if present)
step3.description: The cardboard label attached to the new jersey contains valuable information

points.point1: On a REAL jersey: The club name is clearly indicated (e.g., 'OL', 'Manchester United')
points.point2: The type mention is present: 'H' (Home), 'A' (Away), 'T' (Third)
points.point3: The product code is written above the model name
points.point4: FAKE if marked only 'adidas JSY' without club name = COUNTERFEIT
points.point5: Warning: These labels can be removed and reattached to a fake jersey!

step4.title: Step 4: The barcode number (additional verification)
step4.description: The swing tag barcode allows for precise verification

points.point1: Find the numeric code under the barcode (e.g., 4066761557500)
points.point2: Go to ean-search.org and enter this code
points.point3: The result must match your jersey EXACTLY
points.point4: Example: 4066761557500 = 'adidas Lyon Away Shirt 2023/24'
points.point5: If the code matches another jersey = FAKE
points.point6: Note: Adidas does NOT print this code on the sewn label, only on the swing tag

step5.title: Step 5: Additional visual checks
step5.description: After verifying codes, examine the overall quality

points.point1: Adidas logo: The 3 stripes must be perfectly aligned and neatly embroidered
points.point2: Stitching: Straight, regular, no loose threads
points.point3: Fabric: Technical material (Climalite, Climacool, Aeroready) mentioned on the label
points.point4: No strong chemical smell or visible glue

commonFakes.fake1: Swing tag marked 'adidas JSY' without club name
commonFakes.fake2: Product code that matches another jersey (e.g., HS5184 for Man Utd = Flamengo jersey)
commonFakes.fake3: Incorrect barcode number (e.g., matches Germany 2017 instead of Man Utd 2024)
commonFakes.fake4: Collar label cut off or absent (suspicious seller)
commonFakes.fake5: No results on Google Images for the product code
commonFakes.fake6: Deformed Adidas logo, poorly embroidered or printed (instead of embroidered)
commonFakes.fake7: Abnormally low price (50-70% cheaper than official price)
commonFakes.fake8: Seller who refuses to show collar label in photos

tips.tip1: ALWAYS ask for a photo of the collar label before buying
tips.tip2: Verify the product code on Google Images (most reliable method)
tips.tip3: Prefer sellers with established reputation and positive reviews
tips.tip4: Compare with official photos from Adidas website or club
tips.tip5: Beware of too attractive prices (discount > 50% = suspicious)
tips.tip6: This method works even for old jerseys (2000s+)
tips.tip7: Use ean-search.org for the barcode if swing tag is present
tips.tip8: When in doubt: Don't buy. A real jersey holds its value, a fake doesn't

example1.title: Example 1: Label with product code
example1.description: Here's how to identify the product code on the collar label

points.point1: Visible product code: JL9623
points.point2: Print date linked to the jersey year
points.point4: Well-defined Adidas logo

points.point1: Code H13881 matches Man United instead of Mexico in our example
points.point2: Blurry or misaligned print

example2.title: Example 2: Swing tag
example2.description: The cardboard label attached to new jerseys

points.point1: Club name indicated: 'OL'
points.point2: Type mention: '75' (OL 75th Anniversary Jersey)
points.point4: QR Code to correct jersey

points.point1: Marked only 'adidas JSY'
points.point2: No club name

nike.title: Nike Authentication Guide
nike.description: Complete method to verify the authenticity of a Nike jersey using product codes, labels and manufacturing details

step1.title: Step 1: The product code
step1.description: Located on the small label under the wash label, the product code is your first indicator

points.point1: Format: 6 digits for style + 3 digits for color (e.g., 894430-010)
points.point2: The style code identifies the jersey design/template
points.point3: The color code (after the dash) identifies the specific color variant
points.point4: Type the complete code in Google Images to verify it matches your jersey EXACTLY
points.point5: WARNING: Fakes often reuse real codes! If the code is for France 2020 Away (CD0069-100) but on another team's jersey = FAKE
points.point6: Old jerseys (before 2010) may not have the color code, this is normal

step2.title: Step 2: The production code
step2.description: On the same small label, this code reveals when the jersey was manufactured

points.point1: Format: HO150407SYG (example = Holiday 2015, manufactured April to July)
points.point2: First 2-3 characters = season: SP (Spring), SU (Summer), FA (Fall), HO (Holiday/Winter)
points.point4: Next 4 digits = start and end production months (0407 = April to July)
points.point5: This code must be consistent with the jersey season! A 2023/24 jersey cannot have an HO15 code
points.point6: Fakes often reuse labels on different jerseys, creating inconsistencies

step3.title: Step 3: The swing tag
step3.description: The cardboard label attached to new jerseys contains crucial information

points.point1: Modern placement (since 2021/22): single label on LEFT sleeve only
points.point2: 2016-2020: two labels, one under each sleeve (armpits)
points.point4: The sticker must be a REAL physical sticker, never printed directly
points.point5: The barb (plastic attachment) is ALWAYS black on real Nike
points.point6: The product code on the swing tag MUST match the internal label
points.point7: Size color bar: Gray=XS, Yellow=S, Blue=M, Red=L, Green=XL, White=XXL+

step4.title: Step 4: The collar size label
step4.description: The collar label contains important regional information

points.point1: The country of manufacture ('Made in...') MUST match between collar label and wash label
points.point2: Example: if the collar says 'Made in Indonesia', the interior label must say the same
points.point3: Check regional size correspondences, especially Japanese size (J)
points.point4: Common error on fakes: incorrect Japanese size (e.g., 'J: S' for US L instead of 'J: 2XO')
points.point5: Correct table: US S=J M, US M=J L, US L=J 2XO, US XL=J 3XO, US XXL=J 4XO

step5.title: Step 5: The security tag
step5.description: Located at bottom right of jersey, the security tag contains a unique code

points.point1: The alphanumeric code MUST be unique to your jersey
points.point2: If you find the same code on multiple online listings = FAKE
points.point3: On recent jerseys: quality metallic/holographic strip that changes under light
points.point4: Fakes often use simple flat printing instead of metallic strip
points.point5: Player version: gold/metallic accents | Fan version: silver accents
points.point6: Some hidden details: mini Nike logos or fragments of the word 'SECURITY' in the strip
points.point7: Some older versions: letters 'HEN' or both 'T's of 'AUTHENTIC' in shiny material

step6.title: Step 6: The Swoosh and badges
step6.description: The quality of application of the Nike logo and club badge is revealing

points.point1: The Swoosh must be PERFECT: precise shape, clean edges, no visible threads
points.point2: On a NEW jersey, the fabric around the Swoosh must be FLAT (no wrinkles)
points.point3: Turn the jersey over: the inside behind the Swoosh/badge must be clean, without excess fabric
points.point4: Embroidered badge = fan version | Heat-pressed/silicone badge = player version
points.point5: Verify that the badge type matches the version (fan or player)
points.point6: Watch for misplaced badges, too large/small, or with coarse stitching

commonFakes.fake1: Correct product code but for another jersey/team (e.g., France 2020 code on Germany jersey)
commonFakes.fake2: Inconsistent production code with season (2024 jersey with HO15 code)
commonFakes.fake3: Swing tag with printed sticker instead of real physical sticker
commonFakes.fake4: Label barb attachment that isn't black
commonFakes.fake5: 'Made in...' different between collar label and wash label
commonFakes.fake6: Incorrect Japanese size on collar label
commonFakes.fake7: Identical security code found on multiple online listings
commonFakes.fake8: Security strip without holographic/metallic effect (flat printing)
commonFakes.fake9: Swoosh with wrinkled fabric around it on new jersey
commonFakes.fake10: Dirty inside behind Swoosh/badge (excess fabric, coarse stitching)
commonFakes.fake11: Inconsistent color code (e.g., red jersey with 100-199 code)
commonFakes.fake12: Misplaced swing tag (e.g., on collar for post-2021 jersey)
commonFakes.fake13: Incorrect or absent size color bar on swing tag

tips.tip1: ALWAYS verify complete product code (style + color) on Google Images
tips.tip2: Compare production code with jersey season to detect inconsistencies
tips.tip3: Request photos of ALL labels: collar, wash, small product label, swing tag
tips.tip4: Verify 'Made in...' consistency across all labels
tips.tip5: For new jerseys: require photo of swing tag with black attachment
tips.tip6: Search security code online to verify uniqueness
tips.tip7: Examine Swoosh and badge quality (flip jersey if possible)
tips.tip8: Use regional size table to verify collar label consistency
tips.tip9: Player version jerseys without swing tag are normal (direct team distribution)
tips.tip10: Beware of too low prices: real Nike jerseys hold their value
tips.tip11: When in doubt about any label or code: don't buy

example1.title: Example 1: Product code and production code
example1.description: The small label under the wash label contains essential codes

points.point1: Visible product code: 658789-426 (style + color)
points.point2: Consistent production code: HO150710 (Holiday 2015, July-October)
points.point4: Correct format and perfect alignment

points.point1: Product code for another jersey (Here PSG jersey with FN8721-456 = Barcelona Home 24/25)
points.point2: Production code inconsistent with season
points.point4: Poor alignment or incorrect format

example2.title: Example 2: Swing tag
example2.description: The cardboard label attached to new jerseys

points.point1: Physical sticker (not printed)
points.point2: Black barb attachment
points.point4: Product code matches internal label
points.point5: Correct placement for the year (left sleeve post-2021)

points.point1: Printed sticker (not a real sticker)
points.point2: White barb attachment or incorrect color
points.point4: Product code doesn't match (CD0699-100 = France 2020/22)

example3.title: Example 3: Security tag
example3.description: The tag at bottom right of jersey with unique code and metallic strip

points.point1: Quality metallic/holographic strip
points.point2: Color-changing effect under light
points.point4: Clean and regular stitching
points.point5: Gold accents (player version) or silver (fan version)

points.point1: Flat printed strip (no holographic effect)
points.point2: Code repeated on multiple jerseys
points.point4: No metallic effect

puma.title: Puma Authentication Guide
puma.description: Complete method to verify the authenticity of a Puma jersey using product codes, labels and manufacturing details

step1.title: Step 1: The product code (Style No / Article No)
step1.description: Found on a large label sewn on the left side of the jersey

points.point1: Format: 6 digits + 2 variation digits (e.g., 736251-01)
points.point2: First 6 digits = base jersey model
points.point3: Last 2 digits = color variation (more recent, absent on old jerseys)
points.point4: Type code on kitcod.es or Google Images to verify it matches your jersey EXACTLY
points.point5: WARNING: Fakes often reuse real codes! If code is for Marseille but on Milan jersey = FAKE
points.point6: Jerseys before 2000 may not have label with product code, this is normal

step2.title: Step 2: The production date
step2.description: On recent label versions, Puma indicates exact production date

points.point1: Recent format: Complete visible date (e.g., 15/03/2023)
points.point2: This date must be consistent with jersey season
points.point3: A 2023/24 season jersey cannot have production date in 2020
points.point4: Fakes often reuse same label on different jerseys, creating inconsistencies
points.point5: If date doesn't match season = major RED FLAG

step3.title: Step 3: The production region code
step3.description: Alphanumeric code under production date indicating factory

points.point1: Format: TVNAO (example for Vietnam, Alliance One factory)
points.point2: First character = Probably 'T' for Textile
points.point3: Next 2 characters = ISO country code (VN=Vietnam, TH=Thailand, TR=Turkey)
points.point4: Last 2 characters = Specific factory identifier
points.point5: Country code MUST match 'Made in...' on label
points.point6: You can verify official Puma factories with their public lists (2018, 2023, 2025)

step4.title: Step 4: The regional market code
step4.description: Code on left side of label indicating destination market

points.point1: AM = Americas
points.point2: AP = Asia Pacific
points.point4: This code indicates WHERE product was meant to be sold, not where manufactured
points.point5: Useful for collectors seeking specific regional releases
points.point6: May have slight variations in packaging or compliance information

step5.title: Step 5: The QR Code
step5.description: Recent Puma labels include QR code with unique AD number

points.point1: QR code generally located under product code
points.point2: Scanning code redirects to puma.com with 'AD' number parameter
points.point4: AD number is printed above QR code
points.point5: This code serves for internal tracking and Puma authentication
points.point6: Absence of QR code on old jerseys is normal

step6.title: Step 6: The swing tag
step6.description: Cardboard label attached to collar of new jerseys

points.point1: Sticker must be REAL physical sticker, never printed directly
points.point2: Product code on swing tag MUST match internal label
points.point3: Fakes often use generic label like 'Puma Shirt' without details
points.point4: Real label mentions: Club name + Jersey type (Home/Away) + Color
points.point5: Check regional size conventions: Brazil/Canada = 'G' (Grande) instead of 'L'
points.point6: Japan may use '2XO' instead of 'XL' - verify consistency with region

step7.title: Step 7: The collar label and 'Made in'
step7.description: Collar label contains important regional information

points.point1: Country of manufacture ('Made in...') MUST match between collar and all internal labels
points.point2: Example: if collar says 'Made in Vietnam', wash label must say same
points.point3: Check regional size correspondences, especially Japanese size (J)
points.point4: Correct table: US S=J M, US M=J O (or recent L), US L=J 2XO, US XL=J 3XO, US XXL=J 4XO
points.point5: Note: Recent Puma sometimes uses 'L' instead of 'O' for Japan (Western alignment)
points.point6: Common error on fakes: incorrect Japanese size (e.g., 'J: S' for US L)

step8.title: Step 8: The security tag
step8.description: Small black tag at bottom left of jersey (front view)

points.point1: On recent models: simply marked 'Authentic Licensed Football'
points.point2: On older models: unique alphanumeric code
points.point3: This code should NOT appear in searches (unless it's fake)
points.point4: Tag must be neatly sewn with quality thread
points.point5: Complete absence of tag on recent jersey = suspicious

step9.title: Step 9: The Puma logo (beware of 'Fat Cat')
step9.description: Leaping cat logo must be perfect - beware of 'Fat Cat'

points.point1: Puma must be ELEGANT and athletic, not stocky or puffed up
points.point2: 'Fat Cat' = typical fake defect: cat too thick, deformed, looks 'muscular'
points.point3: Well-defined characteristic shape with exact proportions
points.point4: Quality embroidery or flocking with clean edges
points.point5: Exact position according to model (usually right chest)
points.point6: Always compare with official photos - even slight difference = suspicious

step10.title: Step 10: The club badge
step10.description: Badge must be applied with precision

points.point1: Precise embroidery OR quality heat transfer depending on model
points.point2: Clean edges without smudging
points.point3: All elements (stars, text, borders) perfectly aligned
points.point4: Correct spacing and respected proportions
points.point5: No blurry, off-center or poorly spaced text
points.point6: Compare with official club badge - even small details matter

commonFakes.fake1: Correct product code but for another jersey/team (e.g., Marseille code on Milan jersey)
commonFakes.fake2: Production date inconsistent with jersey season
commonFakes.fake3: Production region code (e.g., TVNAO) not matching 'Made in...'
commonFakes.fake4: Generic swing tag marked 'Puma Shirt' without club mention
commonFakes.fake5: Printed sticker on swing tag instead of real sticker
commonFakes.fake6: 'Made in...' different between collar label and wash/product label
commonFakes.fake7: Incorrect Japanese size on collar label (e.g., J:S for US L instead of J:2XO)
commonFakes.fake8: Security code appearing on multiple online jerseys (should be unique)
commonFakes.fake9: The famous 'Fat Cat' - deformed, stocky or too thick Puma logo
commonFakes.fake10: Club badge with blurry text, off-center elements or incorrect proportions
commonFakes.fake11: Coarse stitching or visible threads on logo/badge
commonFakes.fake12: Absence of security tag on recent jersey
commonFakes.fake13: Typos or incorrect grammar on wash labels
commonFakes.fake14: Missing QR code on very recent jersey (post-2020)

tips.tip1: ALWAYS verify complete product code on kitcod.es or Google Images
tips.tip2: Verify production date matches jersey season
tips.tip3: Compare region code (TVNAO) with 'Made in...' for consistency
tips.tip4: Request photos of ALL labels: collar, wash, large product label, swing tag
tips.tip5: Scan QR code if present and verify it leads to puma.com with AD parameter
tips.tip6: Examine Puma logo CLOSELY - 'Fat Cat' is very common fake defect
tips.tip7: Compare club badge pixel by pixel with official photos
tips.tip8: Verify regional size consistency on collar label (especially Japanese size)
tips.tip9: Consult official Puma factory lists if you want to verify factory code
tips.tip10: For new jerseys: require photo of swing tag with visible club name
tips.tip11: Beware of too low prices: real Puma jerseys hold their value
tips.tip12: When in doubt about any label, logo or code: don't buy

hummel.title: Hummel Authentication Guide
hummel.description: Learn to identify genuine Hummel jerseys with these essential criteria

points.point1: Hummel logo with distinctive chevrons
points.point2: Unique product code
points.point4: Indicated country of manufacture
points.point5: Clear and durable printing

points.point1: Characteristic V shape
points.point2: Precise 45-degree angles
points.point4: Perfect chevron alignment
points.point5: Bright and contrasted colors

points.point1: Breathable technical fabric
points.point2: Pleasant material to touch
points.point4: Colors that don't fade
points.point5: Anti-perspiration properties

points.point1: Straight and solid stitching
points.point2: Well-structured and comfortable collar
points.point4: Durable number printing
points.point5: Careful assembly

whatIsCookie.title: What is a cookie?
whatIsCookie.description: A cookie is a small text file stored on your device when you visit a website. Cookies help us provide a better user experience and improve our services.

necessary.title: 1. Strictly necessary cookies
necessary.description: These cookies are essential for the site to function and cannot be disabled.

auth.label: Authentication cookies
auth.description: Allow you to log in and maintain your active session

analytics.title: 2. Analytics and performance cookies
analytics.description: These cookies help us understand how you use the site to improve our services.
analytics.optOut: You can refuse these cookies via the consent banner without affecting your browsing experience.

preferences.title: Managing your preferences
preferences.description: You can modify your cookie preferences at any time:

options.browser: By deleting cookies from your browser settings
options.banner: By clearing the "cookieConsent" cookie to make the banner reappear

session.label: Session cookies
session.description: Deleted when the browser is closed

consent.label: Consent cookie
consent.description: Kept until 2099 or until manual deletion

rights.title: Your rights (GDPR)
rights.description: In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), you have the right to access, rectify and delete your personal data. To exercise these rights, contact us at

modifications.title: Changes to this policy
modifications.description: We reserve the right to modify this cookie policy at any time. Changes will take effect upon publication on this page. We encourage you to review this page regularly.

footer.text: By using your account, you agree to our

emailSettings.title: Change Email Address
emailSettings.changeSuccess: Email change request sent. Check your inbox.
emailSettings.googleOnlyMessage: Your account is connected via Google. To change your email address, you must do so directly in your Google account.

passwordSettings.title: Security
passwordSettings.passwordTooShort: Password must be at least 8 characters
passwordSettings.googleOnlyMessage: Your account is connected via Google. Your account security is managed by Google. You can change your password in your Google account settings.

sessionSettings.title: Session
sessionSettings.signOutDescription: You will be signed out of your current session

leaderboardPrivacy.title: Leaderboard Privacy
leaderboardPrivacy.description: Manage your visibility in public leaderboards
leaderboardPrivacy.anonymousSuccess: You now appear anonymously in leaderboards
leaderboardPrivacy.visibleSuccess: Your profile is now visible in leaderboards
leaderboardPrivacy.anonymousDescription: Your name, avatar and favorite team will be hidden. You will appear as "Collector #XXXX"
leaderboardPrivacy.currentlyAnonymous: You currently appear as anonymous in all public leaderboards.

cookieSettings.title: Cookie Management
cookieSettings.description: Manage your cookie preferences on Le Vestiaire. You can change your choices at any time.
cookieSettings.modifyDescription: Click to reopen the consent banner and modify your choices.

CookieConsent.title: Cookie Usage
CookieConsent.defaultDescription: We use cookies to improve your experience on Le Vestiaire. These cookies allow us to analyze site usage and improve our services.
CookieConsent.acceptInfo: By clicking "Accept", you agree to the use of analytics cookies. Essential cookies remain active.

proposeDescription.descriptionImprove: Help us improve the description of {name}.
proposeDescription.placeholder: Describe the history of this jersey, its context, its special features, associated memorable events, etc.
proposeDescription.hint: Minimum 50 characters. Be precise and factual.
proposeDescription.success: Your proposal has been successfully submitted! It will be reviewed by our team.

errors.tooShort: The description must contain at least {min} characters

Friends.requestsWillAppear: Your friend requests will appear here

page.title: Leaderboard - The Locker Room
page.description: Discover the best football jersey collectors
page.heading: Leaderboard
page.howItWorksDescription: Leaderboards are updated in real-time. The top 3 all-time and the #1 of the month earn a permanent badge!

tabs.emptyState: No rankings available for this category

errors.rateLimitError: Too many leaderboard requests. Wait a moment.

Admin.pageDescription: Manage jersey proposals submitted by contributors
Admin.heading: Proposal Management
Admin.aboutDescription: Users with the contributor role can propose new jerseys to add to our database. As an administrator, you can approve or reject these proposals.
Admin.approveDescription: The jersey will be created in the database and the contributor will be credited.
Admin.rejectDescription: The proposal will be permanently deleted
Admin.emptyStateDescription: There are currently no pending jersey proposals.
Admin.approveDialogDescription: The jersey {jerseyName} will be added to the database and the contributor will be credited.
Admin.rejectDialogDescription: The proposal {jerseyName} will be permanently deleted. This action is irreversible.

DescriptionProposals.aboutDescription: Users can propose descriptions to enrich jersey pages. You can approve or reject these proposals. Contributors are credited for each approved description.
DescriptionProposals.emptyStateDescription: There are currently no pending description proposals.
DescriptionProposals.approveDialogDescription: This description will replace the current jersey description. The contributor will be credited.
DescriptionProposals.rejectDialogDescription: The proposal will be marked as rejected. You can optionally provide a reason.
DescriptionProposals.rejectionReasonPlaceholder: Explain why this proposal is rejected...

User.myProposalsDescription: View the status of your jersey proposals
User.proposeJerseyTitle: Propose a Jersey - The Locker Room
User.proposeJerseyDescription: Propose a new jersey to add to the database
User.proposeJerseyInfo: You can propose a new jersey to add to our database. Administrators will review your proposal before approving it.
User.tip1: Verify that the jersey doesn't already exist in the database
User.tip2: Use a clear and high-quality photo
User.tip3: Enter the season in YYYY-YY format (e.g., 2025-26, 2024-25) for clubs and YYYY format (2025, 2022, etc.) for national teams
User.tip4: Be precise in the name and description
User.emptyStateDescription: You haven't submitted any jersey proposals yet.

Form.jerseyNamePlaceholder: Will be generated automatically based on your selections...
Form.specialNameHelper: If empty, the name will be "Special Jersey [Club] [Season]"
Form.descriptionPlaceholder: Add a description or details about this jersey...
Form.errorFileNotImage: The file must be an image
Form.errorAllFieldsRequired: All fields are required except description
Form.seasonErrorClub: Invalid format. Use YYYY-YY (e.g., 2025-26) for clubs
Form.seasonErrorNationalTeam: Invalid format. Use YYYY (e.g., 2025) for national teams

Errors.notContributor: You must be a contributor to propose jerseys
Errors.rateLimitProposals: Too many proposals. Try again later.
Errors.rateLimitUploads: Too many uploads. Try again later.
Errors.allFieldsRequired: All fields are required except description
Errors.jerseyExists: This jersey already exists in the database
Errors.proposalExists: A proposal for this jersey is already pending
Errors.jerseyAlreadyExists: A jersey with these characteristics already exists
Errors.cannotMoveImage: Unable to move image to jerseys bucket
